byline.original: By PETER EAVIS and BEN PROTESS

abstract: Lawyers and legal records reveal how Securities and Exchange Commission Dir Mary Jo White's marriage to her lawyer husband John will affect her ability to pursue investigations; White will stop having to recuse herself from cases involving her former private sector clients in April, but ethics rules dictate that she will still have to sit out cases involving her husband's firm, Cravath, Swaine & Moore, which may create party-line stalemate on SEC.
lead_paragraph: The agency’s director, Mary Jo White, must recuse herself from cases handled by her former law firm as well as her husband’s firm, sometimes leaving a party-line stalemate.

headline.main: She Runs S.E.C. He’s a Lawyer. Recusals and Headaches Ensue.
headline.print_headline: She Runs S.E.C. He’s a Lawyer. Recusals and Headaches Ensue.

snippet: The agency’s director, Mary Jo White, must recuse herself from cases handled by her former law firm as well as her husband’s firm, sometimes leaving a party-line stalemate.
